page.title: 07Smarden West - Energy
page.content: Sources of energy are: electricity for lighting, cooking, heating and domestic appliances including light gardening tools such as hedge-trimmers. Oil is used for domestic water heating and central heating. Solid fuel ie. coal, smokeless coal derivatives, and wood, are all used for cooking and heating. Wood-burning stoves and cooker-boilers are becoming popular. Oil is used for running much farm machinery. Natural gas is not piped to the area although supply pipes are nearby, a sore point with many householders as it is the cleanest and most economical fuel. Solar heating for domestic hot water is being considered as an alternative or supplementary source of energy for water and room heating but is not yet in common use.
